    Get locations and location data Getting remote data and photos using API functions Map layout and themes with ggplot2 utility functions Working with simple feature and bounding box objects

    Convert an object to a simple feature or bounding box object

    as_sf.Rd

    Both functions will pass a NULL value without returning an error.

    Usage

    as_sf(x, crs = NULL, ...)

as_bbox(x, crs = NULL, ...)

as_sfc(x, crs = NULL, ...)

    Arguments

    x

    A sf, bbox, sfc, raster, sp, or dataframe object that can be converted into a simple feature or bounding box object. as_bbox() can also convert a vector with xmin, ymin, xmax, and ymax values.

    crs

    Coordinate reference system for sf or bbox obect to return

    ...

    Additional parameters passed to sf::st_bbox() when calling as_bbox() or passed to sf::st_sf(), sf::st_as_sf(), or df_to_sf() for as_sf() (depending on class of x)

    On this page
